Package com.cafean.utils

Class OpTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.utils.OpTimer
  • public final class OpTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple operation timer used for debugging and optimization.

    Operation timers can be used as either a simple one-shot timer for a single operation or as a cumulative averaging timer for many iterations of an operation.

    Single Iteration Timer 

     OpTimer timer = new OpTimer("My operation");
 [Perform Operation]
 timer.endAndPrint();
    This would print a message to STDERR that matches the following:

    OP-Timer[MyClass.myMethod<LINE>]: My operation in 12.345 ms.

    Multiple Iteration Timer 

     OpTimer timer = new OpTimer("My operation");
 while(loop) {
     timer.startIteration();
     [Perform Operation]
     timer.endIteration();
 }
 System.err.println(timer.results());
    The results in this case would include the number of iterations (10,000), the smallest iteration duration (0.987 ms), the average duration (1.111 ms), the longest iteration duration (1.234 ms), and the total duration (123.456 ms).

    OP-Timer[MyClass.myMethod<LINE>]: My operation x 10000 (0.987 / 1.111 / 1.234) 123.456 ms.

    See Also:
    System.nanoTime()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void endAndPrint()
      Records the timing for the single iteration and prints a summary to standard error.
      int endIteration()
      Records the timing for last the iteration started with startIteration().
      void startIteration()
      Sets the start time for the next iteration that will be recorded with endIteration().
      java.lang.String toString()

        the number of iterations recorded (including the one that just ended)
